normalized: the hidden village of the taimanin, gosha village.
it existed in a corner of the kanto region.
it was a city the government, whose sense of impending crisis had become stronger due to the expansion of dark influences, had built as a stronghold of the taimanin.
of course, its existence was top secret.
its outward appearance didn't seem like anything but a commonplace provincial town with lots of greenery, established in a valley.
naturally, in gosha village, which was a modern day hidden village, a training organization for taimanin existed.
named gosha academy.

“gosha” was considered to mean the five (go) elements―comprised of wood, fire, earth, metal and water―which were the foundation of ninja arts, and the pinwheels (sha) ninjas had used since ancient times, i.
e.
throwing stars.
of course, the training of present day ninjas, taimanin, was not limited to that alone.
a disguised special training establishment under government control, being operated under thorough information management and suppression― that was gosha academy.
12 years had already passed since it was established.
outstanding taimanin, expected to be asagi's successors, had been produced from gosha academy one after another.
even to just give the prominent people, sakura, murasaki, yukikaze, rinko, and――
the girl named asuka was also one such taimanin.
that was as it should have been.

he told me we're going to actively consider your budget requests.

he hadn't noticed that kousuke had entered at all.

her appearance was a complete change to when she was on the abandoned island.
appropriately for gosha academy's principal, she was formally dressed, not in ninja clothes, but in a well-tailored suit.
of course, even though she was dressed like that, an intimidating air befitting the strongest taimanin was overflowing from asagi's body.

i was opposed to the budget requests.

an inspection is just fine, given that.

stalker!

name: kousuke
normalized: umm… ah, i'm, happy i could be of help!

with the pair's household losing both parents early, kousuke was brought up by his older brother.
however, 10 years ago, his brother had also fallen into enemy hands and gotten killed.
kousuke, who had become a person without a single relative, was taken in by asagi, and had been looked after by her ever since.
as far as kousuke was concerned, asagi was his older sister, whom he had continuously yearned for since childhood, and was like a mother to him.
feelings of gratitude―he wanted to return the favour of having brought him up.

normalized: to continually get hold of important information on grass missions is truly amazing.

about his disgraceful lust.

his thoughts, his warped feelings, his dark desires―all of kousuke?
kousuke didn't know himself.
kyousuke's image flickered.

after school.
kousuke's figure was in the infirmary, in which the setting sun was shining.

name: kousuke
normalized: it's thanks to muroi-sensei!

good for you.

muroi wanted him to help with his research.
as compensation, muroi offered information that looked useful for kousuke's missions from a privately owned network.
at that time, kousuke wasn't making fatal errors on the grass missions, but didn't have any conspicuous achievements either.
no, just as he couldn't use ninja arts, he was actually below the level for grass.

usually, when kousuke performed grass missions, he was able to acquire information that he couldn't possibly have obtained.

normalized: someday, when kousuke-kun has awoken to his power, by comparing the data from before and after, i might understand what changed, and what the trigger for invoking the ability is.

name: muroi

because he still couldn't use his powers, he was favourable as the object of the examination.

name: muroi
normalized: hmm, that's right.

normalized: what's that, muroi-sensei?

name: muroi
normalized: a drug to awaken the power of you taimanin.

name: kousuke
normalized: a drug to awaken power?
kousuke didn't believe his ears.
he had never seen or heard of such a thing.
taimanin each possessed powers so different that one could say equal abilities did not exist.
it wasn't unusual to have a completely different ability to one's family, even if they were relatives connected by blood.
there were cases like the mizuki family, a prestigious family that had produced users of the “lightning escape technique” for generations, but that was an exception among exceptions.

actually, the ability of asagi, who was a representative of the taimanin, was a hyper-acceleration of her perception and body, but the ability of her younger sister, sakura, was entirely unlike it, being the ability to hide in shadows.
also, what kind of ability they would awaken to was considered unknown until it happened.
because people differed even on their impetus for awakening, there were people who had suddenly, one day, woken up in the morning having become able to use it.
people who sustained a serious injury during a mission and awoken to their power on a hospital bed.
and even people who had had affairs, and awoken from the shock of being spanked by their lover.
of course, there were also people who had awoken to their ability through taimanin-like training.
for this reason, a curriculum of ability development was also included in gosha academy.
training of the mind and body that incorporated japanese shugendou, chinese xiandao, indian yoga, and so forth.
on the other hand, the practical development of athletic abilities, grounded in modern science, was also considered to be effective for the awakening of abilities.

but because those were also derived from the rule of thumb that abilities “appeared” to become likely to manifest if one did things like that, no matter what someone did, whether or not they would awaken to their ability was entirely unknown.
on the contrary, even the likelihood that that person would awaken to their ability was unknown.
in other words, it appeared to be luck.
seeming to have understood from kousuke's uncertain eyes,

name: muroi
normalized: yeah, but it's nothing more than a hypothesis, of course.
i was thinking it might create an impetus to draw out your dormant power.
i wanted to try having you take it.

normalized: me?

normalized: i think, maybe, not only will it draw out your dormant ability, but we could even expect a strengthened effect.
